result.execSummary:
The defendant William S Turbin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: William S Turbin
parties.address: 405 E Red Pine Circle, Dousman, WI 53118

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 267 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Target from case 14CF221 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. DNA Surcharge was waived.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
Continue with aftercare treatment. 
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination after establishing treatment. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Modification of Sentence due to completion of Challenge Incarceration Program on 05/20/2016.  Doc to make sentence conversion.
Received May 31, 2016 dated May 20, 2016 from DOC requesting Amended to JOC
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Defendant William S Turbin in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin G Keane.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 6 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 3 years 3 months, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  Credit for 267 days.
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Restitution of $1,886.25 to be paid to Target (from Case 14CF221) as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with aftercare treatment.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school after establishing treatment.
Sentencing Report submitted by Attorney Keane, prepaired by J.S.

Filed by the Department of Corrections requesting an extension on the due date for the Presentence Investigation. Court approves request, PSI due to the Court no later than November 25, 2014 at 1:00 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: December 5, 2014
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William S Turbin in court, in custody, with attorney Kevin G Keane.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Cases 14CF221 and 14CF351 dismissed and read in to this matter.  Court orders Presentence Investigation to be completed and report filed within 30 days.  Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.
